abstract: New I.R.S. rules proposed after the agency declined to bless the spinoff set limits for when certain spinoffs cannot not get tax-free treatment.
snippet: New I.R.S. rules proposed after the agency declined to bless the spinoff set limits for when certain spinoffs cannot not get tax-free treatment.
lead_paragraph: Call it the “Yahoo rule.” The internet company’s failure to spin off Alibaba to shareholders could be a boon for future separations. The Internal Revenue Service has proposed modified regulations on when such splits can qualify for tax-free treatment. The move occurred after the I.R.S. declined to bless Yahoo’s carve-out of its Alibaba stake last year. Similar deals have been delayed since.

headline.main: Yahoo’s Failed Alibaba Spinoff May Benefit Other Deals
headline.print_headline: Yahoo’s Failed Alibaba Spin Off May Benefit Other Deals
